list_definition.definition: of herbs, especially herbs used to make medicines

list_ex_of_english: Usually the procedure is repeated for several days and sometimes herbal drinks are given afterwards.
In an age when access to physicians was not possible for most people, women often kept ' receipt books ' of popular remedies and herbal cures.
The world of herbal medicine has recently suffered a plethora of books that are hardly worth the paper they are printed on.
Since conventional therapy is often of limited help, fatigued patients may use herbal treatments.
Since it deals with herbal medicine, it describes actions performed on plants.
Most doctors are aware that herbal medicines have experienced a remarkable revival.
Table 1 summarizes the evidence for acupuncture, homoeopathy, spinal manipulation and a herbal remedy used in depression.
There may also be a synergistic relationship between self-care and use of herbal remedies that would warrant further investigation.
